info.title: AnythingLLM Developer API
info.description: API endpoints that enable programmatic reading, writing, and updating of your AnythingLLM instance. UI supplied by Swagger.io.

get.description: Verify the attached Authentication header contains a valid API token.
Check to see if the instance is in multi-user-mode first. Methods are disabled until multi user mode is enabled via the UI.
Check to see if the instance is in multi-user-mode first. Methods are disabled until multi user mode is enabled via the UI.

401.description: Instance is not in Multi-User mode. Method denied

post.description: Create a new user with username and password. Methods are disabled until multi user mode is enabled via the UI.

401.description: Instance is not in Multi-User mode. Method denied

requestBody.description: Key pair object that will define the new user to add to the system.

post.description: Update existing user settings. Methods are disabled until multi user mode is enabled via the UI.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the user in the database.

parameters.description: id of the user in the database.

post.description: Upload a file by specifying its raw text content and metadata values without having to upload a file.

documents.title: hello-world.txt

example.textContent: This is the raw text that will be saved as a document in AnythingLLM.

parameters.description: Unique slug of workspace to delete

post.description: Update workspace settings by its unique slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Unique slug of workspace to find

requestBody.description: JSON object containing new settings to update a workspace. All keys are optional and will not update unless provided

example.name: Updated Workspace Name
example.openAiPrompt: Respond to all inquires and questions in binary - do not respond in any other format.

get.description: Get a workspaces chats regardless of user by its unique slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Unique slug of workspace to find

history.content: AnythingLLM is a platform that allows you to convert notes, PDFs, and other source materials into a chatbot. It ensures privacy, cites its answers, and allows multiple people to interact with the same documents simultaneously. It is particularly useful for businesses to enhance the visibility and readability of various written communications such as SOPs, contracts, and sales calls. You can try it out with a free trial to see if it meets your business needs.

sources.source: object about source document and snippets used

post.description: Add or remove documents from a workspace by its unique slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Unique slug of workspace to find

requestBody.description: JSON object of additions and removals of documents to add to update a workspace. The value should be the folder + filename with the exclusions of the top-level documents path.

post.description: Execute a chat with a workspace

sources.title: anythingllm.txt
sources.chunk: This is a context chunk used in the answer of the prompt by the LLM,

example.error: null | text string of the failure mode.

requestBody.description:
Send a prompt to the workspace and the type of conversation (query or chat).
Query: Will not use LLM unless there are relevant sources from vectorDB & does not recall chat history.
Chat: Uses LLM general knowledge w/custom embeddings to produce output, uses rolling chat history.

post.description: Execute a streamable chat with a workspace

example.error: null | text string of the failure mode.
null | text string of the failure mode.

sources.title: anythingllm.txt
sources.chunk: This is a context chunk used in the answer of the prompt by the LLM. This will only return in the final chunk.

example.error: null | text string of the failure mode.

requestBody.description:
Send a prompt to the workspace and the type of conversation (query or chat).
Query: Will not use LLM unless there are relevant sources from vectorDB & does not recall chat history.
Chat: Uses LLM general knowledge w/custom embeddings to produce output, uses rolling chat history.

post.description: Update a system setting or preference.

requestBody.description: Key pair object that matches a valid setting and value. Get keys from GET /v1/system or refer to codebase.
